overview_of_class:
This course is an introduction to foundational works of twentieth century Asian American literature?works that are essential reading for any serious student of Asian American literature, history, and culture.
We will begin with the revolutionary autobiographies of anarchist Dhan Gopal Mukerji and labor organizer Carlos Bulosan, continue with John Okada's hard-hitting novel No-No Boy, and conclude with the genre-defying experiments of Maxine Hong Kingston and Theresa Hak Kyung Cha. Whether or not you have any prior experience with Asian American literature, if you are interested in the political power and legacies of Asian American writing; the daring creative experiments of Asian American writers; or the multi-generational history of Asian American literary traditions, then this is the course for you.
name: Introduction to Asian American Literature
